boardgame.name: Pieks
boardgame.description:
Fend off the mosquitoes...

The players roll the dice. Whoever has mosquitoes is bitten, whoever has a swat can ward off mosquitoes. You can still modify your result. The game ends as soon as a player has received 10 mosquito bites.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Piratengold
boardgame.description:
As pirates, the players try to prevent losing all their gold, because everyone wants to get their hands on the shiny metal.

The dice are rolled to see whether gold has been rolled or whether the skulls predominate. Without gold it becomes dangerous...

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Schatzkammer
boardgame.description:
Be the first player to find four identical gems.

The players roll the dice and advance in the treasure chamber. But you can only score points if you find the right gems. The game ends as soon as a player has rolled (i.e. marked) a gemstone type four times.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: in*die zine (Mar 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

2021's first edition of the in*die zine!

Our theme this time is GENDER—norms, expectations, feels. Get four intriguing games, two interesting supplements for your table, one epic photocomic, and d66 sets of pronouns for your characters. Smash the patriarchy and deconstruct gender!

All proceeds go directly to the creators of this zine, and your support is a vote in support of the indie TTRPG scene!

Here's what you can find in this issue:

In Die20! III: Revenge of the Cis, read about how RPGs lock us down to a single category and identity, and how and why we might want to rethink that.
In Seven Rituals for Divination, reflect on experiences of and relationships with gender.
In d66 Pronouns, roll to find some innovative character pronouns.
In Social Deconstruction, explore the social construction of gender by making and breaking your own gender system.
In HyperHalfling's Lists, meet a selection of non-binary persons who may populate your game space.
In Songs and Poems for Yon Adventures, find a song that is definitely not a thinly veiled reference to how gender expression is taught to us.
In There's a reason Knights have Shining Armour, babe, explore the themes of gender dysphoria through the disconnect of a person's values and the expectations of their knightly order
In For The King: A Chess RPG, play An RPG of struggle, duty, and rebellion on a 8x8 chessboard.
In Crocheted Adventurers, meet a new character in this ongoing yarn.

boardgame.name: Waldbären
boardgame.description:
The players try to find as many bears as possible in their forest.

The dice are rolled and depending on the symbols achieved, you can either find bears or only encounter useless trees. But if you are lucky, you can also push them onto the other players' eyes or even steal bears from them. In the end, you need many bears and should have them in the right places.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: in*die zine (Jun 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The most powerful edition of the in*die zine yet!

Our theme this time is POWER in all its forms. Can you corrupt power? Absolutely, corrupt power! We dedicate articles, games, and supplements to power and powers in all their various forms.

All proceeds go directly to the creators of this zine, and your support is a vote in support of the indie TTRPG scene!

Here's what you can find in this issue:

In Poems and Songs for Yon Adventure, add a conlang rebel anthem to your game!
In Jane Reviews: Testament!, read our review of the latest roleplaying game from King James Publishing, The Old Testament.
In Design Dive: Power in Horror, learn about the design decisions behind the Locus horror roleplaying game.
In Power in the Metagame, reflect on the power dynamics between the GM and other players.
In How to Feel Powerful, read about power fantasies and how they make you, the player, feel powerful.
In Unionize, the RPG, organise a workforce and start your own union. Fictional, of course, unless...?
In No Witches Just Superheroes, play superheroes at the time of witches, and don't let the bastards grind you down.
In Yet Another Crocheted Adventure, see how our plucky (sigh) adventurers deal with making camp.
In #SixMoves: Power Edition, get some more PbtA moves built around different kinds of power.
In Hidden Within Walls, draw two maps of the same town, with one representing its power, and the other its strength.
In Cheeky Robot Experiment, play an exasperated scientist trying to make a passive-aggressive robot do even the smallest task.
In HyperHalfling's Lists #4, get some items (tangible and intangible) with which to wield power.
In Die20! IV: Powergaming Is F***ing Awesome, Actually, try to understand why minmaxing and powergaming are actually pretty fun, and one way to express yourself creatively.

boardgame.name: Marvel Dice Throne
boardgame.description:
In Marvel Dice Throne , you become one of eight of Marvel's most famous heroes, including Black Panther, Captain Marvel, Black Widow, Scarlet Witch, Loki, Thor, Doctor Strange, and Miles Morales Spider-man! Every Marvel Dice Throne hero was painstakingly designed and balanced to provide the most thematic experience possible, allowing you to truly embody your favorite heroes like no other game. Featuring all-new mechanisms and asymmetrical designs, these are our most innovative and exciting heroes yet.

Marvel Dice Throne is a heart-pumping, fast-playing game of skilled card play and dice manipulation supporting multiple modes of play, including 1v1, 2v2, 3v3, 2v2v2, or free-for-all.

Attack your opponents and activate abilities by rolling your hero's unique set of five dice. Accumulate combat points and spend them on cards that have a large range of effects, such as granting permanent hero upgrades, applying status effects, and manipulating dice directly (yours, your teammate's, or even your opponent's).

All 8 heroes are compatible with the entire Dice Throne ecosystem
Use upgrade cards to improve your hero abilities as the game progresses
Play action cards strategically to manipulate dice and surprise your foe
Features a deluxe, highly functional, Battle Chest storage system
Each hero in the Battle Chest has their own beautiful set of custom swirl dice

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: in*die zine (Sep 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Summer remembered...

Whether you're just starting summer, or just leaving it, we've got the issue for you! Full of wistful games, supplements, and articles, all about memories of summers both good and bad.

All proceeds go directly to the creators of this zine, and your support is a vote in support of the indie TTRPG scene!

Here's what you can find in this issue:

Ice Busters! is a whimsical little physical game to be played in the shade on warm summer days
Summer Drinks for Summer Games is a menu of games with summer vibes paired with mock- and cocktails to imbibe while playing
Die20! V: Play That F***ing Game is about playing things like we did when we were kids - find a weird game and play it with your friends on the fly
Perfect Summer Body is a game-spell to create the perfect summer body
Midsummer & Other Festivals is part-supplement, part-article, all advice on creating festivals, holidays, and season rituals in your campaign world
Hay Babe is a love story game of a farmer who fell in love with the worker they hired to make hay, and the memories that come to him as he feeds the hay out through the winter
HyperHalfling's List #5 is a set of tables of things you might find in the height of summer in your game
The Summer Lad and Autumn Lass is a fan song about the tragic relationship that was Vaxleth in Critical Role
She Traveled, You Stayed / You Traveled, She Stayed is a solo or duet game about two witches meeting thirty years after their last summer adventure
The Maven Guide 3.0 is a collection of yelp-style reviews of summery places you might find on your next adventure

boardgame.name: Noble's Manor House
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the noble's manor houses in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Deadly Gardens Book I
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Deadly Gardens Book I. We are excited to bring this series to the 5th Edition Fantasy ruleset! In our Deadly Gardens series for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, we published over 50 original plant and nature-themed monsters for that game. Rusted Iron Games is now proud to start bringing those same original monsters to your 5th Edition games!

boardgame.name: Rings II
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every fantasy hero campaign needs magical treasures for the adventures to find. This series will house varies information on just such treasures.

Rings – Every adventurer wants to have a ring to help him or her in their adventures.

Here you will find over 36 rings to add to your Fantasy Hero campaign. From the Ring of Water Walking or Ring of Falling or Ring of Weaponry To the Ring of Shocking Grasp

boardgame.name: Were Wares
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What To Do When You Awoo: A Guide for the Newbie Werewolf

Unleash your inner beast with Were Wares, the newest PDF from Tipsy Tabby Publishing!

The werewolf, among other lycanthropes, is a creature that many players might want to play, for many reasons. Some think it might make a good story; others want the power; and some just identify with the struggle to balance one's life.

But rules for balancing a lycanthrope character are as rare as a balanced life is anyway, and as such, this particular archetype is beyond the reach of most players of the 3.X systems...until today!

By utilizing a system of feats that showcase one's control over the lycanthropic condition, complete with a pool of points to use these feats, a player character can call themselves a were-whatever at any point wherein they contract the curse – even if it happened before Session 1!

So go ahead, run in the light of the full moon and hunt in the wilds! Just remember to be home by dawn...

boardgame.name: The Inventor of Goldleaf Manor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Inventor of Goldleaf Manor is a Fifth Edition adventure designed and optimized for four players of 2nd level. This adventure works well set in remote rural areas, a small country village or a larger metropolis area.

Background
Many years ago a wealthy gnome inventor named Jerome Goldleaf embarked on an ambitious project to create two metal creations that he would bring to life with his own consciousness. After a century and a half of research into rituals and construction, his life's work was complete and just in time. As Jerome reached age 398 he felt his life was nearly at its end and so he began the ritual...

Sometime later, glass eyes opened and blinked to life and two lifeforms rose from sleep into a world they knew but couldn't remember.

They awoke in a laboratory wondering what had happened and where they came from. Coglax and Grindlor, as they became known, started their lives by following their only possessed desire: mechanical invention. The two constructs tried to work alongside one another but found it too difficult, this was because Jerome had unknowingly split the personality of his critical and calculating left brain from his emotional and imaginative right brain. Coglax, Jerome's right brain, soon became convinced that Grindlor, Jerome's left brain, was out to destroy him. So Coglax began to build contraptions and constructs bent on the destruction of Grindlor, who followed suit in defense. The halls in and below the manor became filled with death traps of two paranoid creations. Could there be a way to make Jerome's work whole?

boardgame.name: Boilgut's Throne
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Boilgut’s Throne is a Fifth Edition adventure designed and optimized for four players of 1st level. This adventure works well set in remote rural areas near a lake or close to a small country village.

Background
A number of years ago a druid adventurer was attacked by a small troop of goblins in the woods. In his dying breath, the druid inflicted a curse on the goblin who ended his life. After a few days, the curse began to show itself: large goiter like boils began to grow all over his body and thick mucus-like bile pooled in his throat. The goblin, now estranged from his tribe, suffered alone as the curse warped his form into that of a bloated and grotesque creature.

After some time this goblin came upon another tribe of goblins. These new goblins attacked him upon seeing his horrifying form. The cursed goblin suddenly vomited acidic bile on one of his attackers, killing it instantly. The other creatures stopped their assault and revered the cursed one as being blessed with a divine gift from their god.

They deemed the cursed one: Boilgut, and he became their leader and king.

boardgame.name: Attack in Wicker Woods
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Attack in Wicker Woods is a Fifth Edition adventure designed and optimized for four players of 2nd level. This adventure works best set in a deep wood or thicket.

Background
A clan of nasty grosslins (chaotic evil, chicken-like humanoids) have settled in a dungeon ruin located deep in the Wicker Woods. These creatures only take pleasure in sacrifices made to their manufactured deities: Grakknovar and Plekknovar that are in reality a mating pair of cockatrices. The grosslins make a habit of burning humanoid victims alive in a grand ritual in front of their deities' 'avatars’. While exciting to the grosslins, this act never truly satisfies their chaotic blood lust. Anyone caught by these vile creatures does not last very long...

boardgame.name: Treacle Cave
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Treacle Cave is a Fifth Edition adventure designed and optimized for four players of 1st level. This adventure works well set close to a small country village or on the outskirts of an urban metropolis.

Background
For many years Treacle Cave and the swamp that surrounds it have been avoided. Locals whisper of foul green creatures that kidnap wandering citizens in the night. Unlucky for the Rancor family, night fell on their journey home quicker than they realized. As the moon began to rise so did the nerves of Frieda and Anton along with their young daughter Daisy. Suddenly, an ambush was sprung. Two green creatures leaped out of the swamp and began to attack the family's humble wagon. Anton fought bravely but was subdued after which he and Daisy were snatched up. This left Frieda unconscious and alone in the wake of the destruction. Once she awoke Frieda panicked and began to weep. Is there anyone out there who can help rescue her beloved family?

boardgame.name: The Tomb of Evelyn Crimson
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tomb of Evelyn Crimson is a Fifth Edition adventure designed and optimized for four players of 3rd level. This adventure works well set in a small country village or larger metropolis area.

Background
Evelyn Crimson was a vile and cruel woman but most people never knew the depth of her cruelty. She gained her wealth through blackmail, slavery, and murder. Over her life, Evelyn had many husbands each meeting the same mysterious fate, after which all their riches were seized by Evelyn. Due to Evelyn's power and reach in the land, no one dared look into the circumstances which took these unfortunate men. One of her husbands: Adam Deruta was a wealthy merchant trader and after an idyllic romance, he and Evelyn bore a daughter they named Diana. By Diana’s third birthday Adam had discovered Evelyn's true nature and quickly formed a plan to send his only daughter away to live a life far from her mother. It was not long after this that Adam soon met the same fate as Evelyn's other suitors and disappeared without a trace.

boardgame.name: The Kyeton Killers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nest of Thorns is a Fifth Edition adventure designed and optimized for four players of 6th level. This adventure works well set near a small village or on the outskirts of an urban metropolis, somewhere an empire, republic or militia owns inspection outposts near a border.

Background
The Kyeton Killers are a fierce and powerful gang of cutthroats, led by a human female necromancer named Fel Kyeton.
Fel came from a line of arcane wielders who became disappointed with her magic abilities. The Kyeton's proceeded to cast Fel out of the family home and ostracized her from their lineage. Fel grew bitter over the years and has been attempting to grow powerful enough to slay her entire family. This blood-thirsty ambition began to attract other hateful kinds and soon a band of killers was born.
One week ago the Killers infiltrated an imperial outpost stationed near the edge of the empire. The bandits coordinated several swift and simultaneous attacks which crippled the outpost's defenses. Soon after Fel used her magic to turn the fallen imperial knights into undead slaves which helped to clean up the rest of the platoon.
No survivors remained and the gang silently slipped into the roles of the outpost. They now use it to extort money from travelers and to build an undead horde by slaying those who appear to possess resistance or wealth. Many have fallen prey to the Kyeton Killers, will the party be next?

boardgame.name: Fort Ogon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fort Ogon is a Fifth Edition adventure designed and optimized for four players of 5th level. This adventure works well set close to a small country village or in a remote valley.

Background
Fort Evander was established nearly three years ago in order to protect the growing city of Borilhaven. Captain Dana Fleetwood and her platoon were stationed by the empire to occupy and defend the imperial outpost. All was well until, a month ago when a warring band of hobgoblins ambushed Fort Evander and wiped out all the defenses there. Of the few who escaped came reports of a troll allied to the hobgoblins’ leader, Ogon. This troll, Kresh, tore through the soldiers as did the hobgoblins warriors who siged the outpost. There the goblinoids have remained, no one sure of what their future plans may be. The empire is now searching for mercenaries to take back the fort and put down the creatures within. The rest of the hobgoblin warband remained behind at their stronghold further north where they are nearly two hundred soldiers strong.

boardgame.name: Nest of Thorns
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nest of Thorns is a Fifth Edition adventure designed and optimized for four players of 4th level. This adventure works well set close to a small country village or on the outskirts of an urban metropolis.

Background
Long ago there was a congregation of monks, who through their devotion to the goddess Morlannah, were blessed with a sacred item that became known as the Cup of Favor. This item became sought for the goddess's blessing as it allowed those who drank from it to bend their fate.
As word spread of the cup and its abilities, these rumors attracted the attention of a greedy blue dragon who wished its blessing for herself. A battle ensued between cultists of the dragon and the monks of the temple. The cultists were driven back but not without a great loss of life. Because of this, the monks decided the cup was too dangerous to keep so they abandoned the treasure and their shrine, in hopes that greed would no longer bring violence upon their ranks. So the Cup of Favor lay hidden among the ruins of the temple.
Eight years ago, after decades of squatters and explorers venturing into the ruins, a mating pair of manticores took up residence within the ancient temple complex and eventually discovered the lost artifact. Lady Estelle, the female manticore, claimed the Cup of Favor and began using it to acquire new treasures. She and her mate Kalesh, currently enjoy luring adventurers to their newfound lair and toying with them at games of wit and chance, slaying those who dare try and best them.

boardgame.name: Forbidden Bestiary: The Voidling
Voidling
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the dark of night the Voidling stalks you. Thirsting for your soul, this unique monster fits right at home in a haunted forest inn, a peculiar country village, or haunted convent. The worst part, is that the nature of this creation prevents you from really knowing who to trust!

This supplement introduces a new ferocious predator, something new for you to experience and designed specifically to supplement horror encounters for low-level players.

boardgame.name: Monsters Inc.
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The future is bright at Monsters, Incorporated.

We're part of your life.
We power your car.
We warm your home.
We light your city.

Carefully matching every child to their ideal monster to produce superior scream refined into clean, dependable energy.

Every time you turn something on: Monsters, Incorporated is there.

boardgame.name: Space Aces: The New Guidebook
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Space Aces is rooted in a love of all things campy sci-fi. It is a tools over rules system that supports GM-led and GM-less (solo or co-op) play.

The generator tables are crafted to provide a minimalist and evocative “hard edge” for players and GMs to crystalize their ideas on. The fun of Space Aces is often in interpreting the results together.

boardgame.name: Space Aces: The Original Sheets
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In Outer Space, there's tons of things to do. When you have a thing that you want done, contract the Space Aces! We are mostly competent, heavily in debt, and highly motivated!

Do you love rules-lite no-prep sci-fi rpg games like Lasers & Feelings but wish it had a little more to it? Crave the emergent narratives of Fate, PBtA and Genesys system games without all the RULES? Love the danger of OSR games and the simplicity of FKR games? Have good eyesight and want an entire game system that fits entirely on a business card?

Meet Space Aces!

Space Aces is a modular system that utilizes a super simple D20 & D6 rolling system that gives you lots of interesting narrative results to rolls. A success can still result in a Cost, and a failure can still result in a Benefit... Ramp up difficulty, tension, and consequences as the mission goes on with the Heat Level meter. Everything you need to play on one business card.

Do you and your crew have the Gumption it takes to complete the mission? Or will you be Taken Out like yesterday's space baguettes? Whatever happens... Adventure Awaits!

User summary:

The game is distributed as ten 2-page PDF documents (intended for print-and-play) and also as a single, combined 20-page PDF document.

boardgame.name: The Anatomical Guide to Lovecraftian Horrors
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

What is the skeletal structure of a deep one? How does the byakhee hune organ allow them to travel through interstellar space? What organs and biological material make up the mysterious and ancient flying polyps? These questions and more will be answered in [this] groundbreaking scientific study of the anatomy, biology, and ecology of more than two dozen Lovecraftian horrors!

boardgame.name: The Book of Rituals
Das Buch der Riten
Cartea Ritualurilor
Dziennik: Księga Rytuałów
Le Livre des Rituels
boardgame.description:
The Book of Rituals is a book full of puzzles set in the universe known from the Escape Tales series of games. While solving the tasks presented in the book, players assume the role of discoverers of secret knowledge. Each subsequent task will reveal the secrets of the elements and alchemical ingredients, to finally allow them to perform various magical rituals. In total, 45 tasks of various formulas and types await players — from less complex puzzles to complex, multi-stage riddles.

The topics covered in the book refer directly to the events of the Escape Tales series. Although knowledge of games is not necessary to solve riddles, experienced players will find flavors and references to the series' stories here. Important characters from the games, such as Samuel from The Awakening or heroes from Children of Wyrmwoods. These characters become secondary heroes in The Book of Rituals, who, just like the players, have delved into the book's secrets. For better or for worse...

Solving riddles is done with the help of a free application that does not require installation on devices and works on both mobile devices and computers. It is primarily used to check answers but also provides hints for riddles. What is characteristic of the Escape Tales products is that players are not judged or punished for using the hints. The overall goal is player satisfaction, so the application is designed to help them, not judge them.

The Book of Rituals is a breath of fresh air in the mystery book market. It stands out from the competition with a formula that encourages and sometimes forces the book's exploration in the order that is convenient for players — it does not have a single path from puzzle to puzzle. The mechanics have been prepared in such a way that players who get stuck on one of the tasks can freely solve others and return to it with fresh ideas or use the hints without the feeling of losing. Thanks to the creative use of the application, the book can also surprise players.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
Brand new copy of the game, in shrink wrap.
Shipping to EU would be 10 euro and the package should arrive in 7-10 days. Elsewhere – please ask!
Check out my other products for sale as well! If you buy multiple items, I will combine shipping costs. It’s much cheaper this way.
New. Shipping is extra, will combine shipping with other titles for savings.

boardgame.name: D13 RPG
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:


“Where there is no imagination there is no horror.”
— Arthur Conan Doyle


Horror maims and kills.

That makes the genre a tough beast to tame for any role-playing game. And once tamed, it isn’t horror any longer.

Other genres—fantasy, sci-fi, westerns, modern combat, and such—are about characters who go seeking adventure. It’s only natural that their lives are a string of such escapades.

But horror stories involve innocents caught up in peril they never sought out. Even if they survive, they’ll be scarred physically or psychologically.

This game of “grim horror across time and space" depicts just that, in an episodic fashion like an anthology or TV series. With it you can play any horror plot you have ever read, seen on film, or yourself imagined.

Within the pages you’ll find a “One Roll to Rule Them All” system, using a unique “dl3” mechanic for actions, and tarot cards to represent the dangerous, unwieldy nature of paranormal abilities.

Horror maims and kills. Are you ready to face it?

From the introduction:

The D13 RPG uses two dice for action rolls—one with 4 sides and one with 10 sides.

The die with 4 sides is referred to as d4.
The die with 10 sides is referred to as d9 in this game, because its faces are read as 0 through 9.
Together the two dice are referred to as d13, because when rolled and added, the result ranges from 1 to 13.

boardgame.name: Bookmark No HP RPG
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A unique, universal-genre role-playing game that fits on a bookmark!

Don't let its small size fool you! This "One Roll to Rule Them All™" polyhedral dice system is robust, using a simple 1-10 scale for action difficulty, and combining success, damage, and character improvement in a single action roll!

With character design in literally a minute, it's great for introducing new players to the hobby. Just choose a name, invent an occupation, rate four stats, and you're ready to go!

And while perfect for one-shots and convention pick-up play, it can also support mini-campaigns of a half-dozen adventures or more with the same characters.

Yes, that's a lot to claim for an RPG on a bookmark, but the designer is known around the world for unique approaches to odds-based dice mechanics. How much are you really risking for $4.99?

boardgame.name: Inspector Penguin
boardgame.description:
Inspector Penguin is a bluffing card game for 2-4 players. The goal of the game is to craft jewelry with normal and magical pebbles. Magical pebbles are forbidden and risky to use, but give you a bonus action. Beware of the Inspector Penguin who can block you from crafting jewelry if they uncover a magical pebble. Use your action cards strategically to help you dodge the inspector, or help you sniff out magical pebbles.

Test your luck and bluffing skills in this fast-paced, highly interactive (cute) card game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Tabletop Archaeology 101
boardgame.description: Tabletop Archaeology 101 is a simple roll table dice game where each player takes on the role of a Hollywood archaeologist. Your rolls will determine what you find, whether you trigger traps, and if you encounter raiders. Welcome to the dig site.

boardgame.name: Blokk! Hazard: The Expansion
boardgame.description:
In Blokk! Hazard you are the Engineer and have been assigned to obstruct your opponent known as the Architect, in order to construct The Tower.

To start a game, Engineers are given 10 complex Hazard blocks. Architects select one of the three difficulty modes: Hand-pick their own blocks, roll the dice, or draw a card from the deck. Architects use a 5x5 grid to start building their tower.
But Architects beware: your opponent’s blocks will count against you!

boardgame.name: Nano Battle: Ultimate Keshi Combat
boardgame.description:
A tabletop combat game system using 1.75 inch little rubber keshi figures called Nanoids. Take control of Nanoids as an Operator, your task is to close the power hungry rifts opening all over the world.

Use your 6 Command cards to simultaneously activate your Nanoids in Nano Battle! Each card has a number indicating how many seconds it takes for your Nanoid to act in battle, a Dodge is almost instant while a Super move might take some time. Deplete each others Life Sparks while avoiding peril on the Nano Fields stabilizing the rifts.

Be careful, once your last Command card in hand is activated each round the rift consumes its data, never to be used in this match again. 21 total choices before you run out of commands and your Nanoid goes rogue. Can you defeat your opponent while your Nanoid is choosing its own commands?

An expandable game system of Rumble and Nanoid Packs. Rumble Packs provide everything for 2 players to Nano Battle and can be combined or used stand-alone. Nanoid Packs add more colorful Nanoids to your arsenal of little warriors. More pack types to come such as Story and Megoids.

boardgame.name: Necromunda: House of Shadow
boardgame.description:
Discover the mysterious origins and agendas of House Delaque, from their plots and schemes against the other Houses to the truth behind their steady spread across the Hive world.

Inside you will find:

1) Updated rules for creating and running House Delaque gangs including new rules for Psy-Gheists or the preternatural assassins and saboteurs known as the Nacht-Ghuls.

2) New rules for adding Hired guns as well as Delaque specific Dramatis Personae such as Yageloth the Whisperer and the terrifying Servant of the Silent Ones.

3) New sub-plots, a unique Delaque skill set, terrain and House features

4) New Scenario's specific for the House of Shadow

boardgame.name: Don't Cross Me!
boardgame.description:
Guile! Vengeance! Buttmunchery!

Build new sets and runs that "cross" your opponents' to earn specialty cards fromt he Devious Deck! Then use these "Deevies" to hose over your closest friends and family as. you trategize your way to victory!

boardgame.name: On Porpoise
boardgame.description:
The best dressed dolphin takes the ocean in this fast paced card game. You will be challenged by polka dots, paisley patterns and predators as you race to get rid of your cards first. Keep a look out because there are more than just sharks in this water.
Catch the cards played on porpoise and you might live to tell the tale.

Cards are divided evenly between all players and placed in face down stacks. In tge center of tge table are the three porpoise cards, the head (which needs a hat), the body (which needs a jacket) and the tail (which every well dressed porpoise should cover). All players play cards simultaneously in an attempt to match the existing clothing patterns or clothing colors currently played on the porpoise in the center of the table. The first player to play their entire card stack wins the game!

boardgame.name: KRISTIAN: PALADIN
boardgame.description:
From the description:

EVERY DAY WE FALL FARTHER FROM GRACE!

What would an ANTI-Paladin jam be without the one thing we all oppose. Here's a self-righteous, arrogant, murder hobo looking to cleanse the world and slay all who fall short of his unattainable ideals.

NONE ARE WORTHY OF HIS MERCY IN THIS DEBASED WORLD!

boardgame.name: Dracula's Get
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are Dracula’s child. Thrall to an undiscovered bride, you roam the earth across the centuries until she calls, surviving as best you may.

Supernatural abilities and weaknesses in this setting are faithful to the original Dracula novel by Bram Stoker. No sparkly vampires. No sunlight incineration. No secret world-spanning society manipulating human history. Just solitary creatures of the night in an inimical world.

boardgame.name: Hack100
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Simple, Flexible d100 Gaming

Hack100 is an old-school flavoured percentile-based tabletop role-playing game in which characters can be created in minutes and the vast majority of in-game actions are covered by around a dozen, rather than dozens of, skills.

It is also extremely flexible, eschewing standard lists of professions, skills, powers and monsters in favour of a freeform, collaborative approach.

The intention is to provide a streamlined system that is quick, easy and intuitive to use. This allows a game to flow naturally with minimal interruptions for the referencing of rules.

boardgame.name: The Curse of Bloodstone Isle - On the Peculiarities of Ruby Isle: The Time & Space Trap, an Episodic Campaign of Myth, Mystery, and Madness - Episode Five: Smugglers Cove
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

If you manage to navigate the dangerous shoals around Scavenger Rocks, or brave the toll road or other dangerous land routes, you may find yourself in Smugglers Cove, a haven for those spurned by society or lost at sea. A safe harbour often, but a dangerous place all the same. A place of treachery and monsters above and below the waves. Comrades that would risk their lives defending each other in a sea battle may very well trick each other of their ill-gotten gains when at shore. Sea monsters to swallow you whole, or tear ships asunder. Where troth might be very hard to find, yet somehow present in how these people live their lives and put their trust in the hands of their comrades, captains, and ships. Live free in a sense, yet better keep one eye on the purse and one hand on the hilt of your blade. Hopefully the code these pirates swear by will make things a bit less dodgy, or will it?

boardgame.name: The Curse of Bloodstone Isle - On the Peculiarities of Ruby Isle: The Time & Space Trap, an Episodic Campaign of Myth, Mystery, and Madness - Episode Six: BleakStone City
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

BleakStone City is the shining pearl of BloodStone Isle: Beautiful white walls and towering ramparts, regal and standing strong in opposition to the perils of the Accused Isle. This is what the Æthenra believe, blind to the truth of what BleakStone has become. The city is crumbling, figuratively and literally. Facades are weakening from a lack of upkeep and the streets are cracked and pockmarked with potholes. Once verdant gardens and trees that lined the avenues sadly mirror the city’s fallen state. The populace moves through the necessities of their lives, from home to work, to market, to church. In BleakStone, everyone has an angle, and that one person that can be trusted is likely the last person that should be trusted. The city is unknowingly in its death rattle, to the ignorance and indifference of all but a few.

boardgame.name: Escape Quest: Alla Ricerca del Tesoro Perduto
Escape Quest: Poszukiwacze zaginionego skarbu.
Escape Quest: Search for the Lost Treasure
Escape Spiel: Die Jagd nach dem verlorenen Schatz
boardgame.description:
Embark on a series of standalone adventures in which YOU will be the main character, during which to move forward you must solve mysterious puzzles to avoid all the traps and obstacles in your way. But beware! Only faultless logic and clever deduction will let you beat all the riddles and advance through the story. Will you be up to the challenge?

Escape Quest is an adventure gamebook series born of a collaboration between Ynnis’ publishing team and Don’t Panic Games’ design team. It is the fruit of all our combined knowledge of game design and book publishing. Much more than just a “gamified book” or a “book-like game”, we put great care in conceiving each of those volumes - collaborating with award-winning game designers, authors and illustrators - to create an immersive, fun experience that is both a great book and a great game.

SEARCH FOR THE LOST TREASURE

The greatest explorer of the century, Sarah Edson-Taylor, sent you her journal just before her mysterious death. With it came a letter and a challenge.

Her life’s work is at stake, and she doesn’t know whom to trust with her secrets. Perhaps she picked you for a reason. Her precious artefacts are hidden; will you be able to unlock the journal’s mysteries for the clues that will let you follow in her footsteps?

Embark on a worldwide race of mystery and adventure and be the first to find the Lost Treasure!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Escape Quest: Alone in Salem
Escape Quest: Sam w Salem
boardgame.description:
Embark on a series of standalone adventures in which YOU will be the main character, during which to move forward you must solve mysterious puzzles to avoid all the traps and obstacles in your way. But beware! Only faultless logic and clever deduction will let you beat all the riddles and advance through the story. Will you be up to the challenge?

Escape Quest is an adventure gamebook series born of a collaboration between Ynnis’ publishing team and Don’t Panic Games’ design team. It is the fruit of all our combined knowledge of game design and book publishing. Much more than just a “gamified book” or a “book-like game”, we put great care in conceiving each of those volumes - collaborating with award-winning game designers, authors and illustrators - to create an immersive, fun experience that is both a great book and a great game.

ALONE IN SALEM

You say witch like it’s a bad thing!

You are on vacation and treating yourself to a famous “Salem Witch Tour” in the village well-known for its witch trials centuries before. But when you decide to leave your group, the visit quickly turns into an occult nightmare! Find your way into the museum and escape the clutches of a mysterious cult. Signs and omens are everywhere, and your doom seems unavoidable. Will you have the wits to survive? Alone in Salem, do you have what it takes to make it through the night?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Escape Quest: Lupin's Challenge
boardgame.description:
Embark on a series of standalone adventures in which YOU will be the main character, during which to move forward you must solve mysterious puzzles to avoid all the traps and obstacles in your way. But beware! Only faultless logic and clever deduction will let you beat all the riddles and advance through the story. Will you be up to the challenge?

Escape Quest is an adventure gamebook series born of a collaboration between Ynnis’ publishing team and Don’t Panic Games’ design team. It is the fruit of all our combined knowledge of game design and book publishing. Much more than just a “gamified book” or a “book-like game”, we put great care in conceiving each of those volumes - collaborating with award-winning game designers, authors and illustrators - to create an immersive, fun experience that is both a great book and a great game.

LUPIN'S CHALLENGE

Cat-burglar extraordinaire!

Travel to Paris in the steam-powered era of the gentleman burglar, Arsène Lupin as he makes an announcement that shocks the shadowy community of the underworld to its core: He has decided it is time to pass on his knowledge and so issued a challenge. The first thief who can steal a certain prize jewel will become his new apprentice and learn all of his secrets! He has left puzzles and riddles that could slow you down or speed you on your way. Study your mark carefully, to plan for the heist of the century and succeed before anyone else. Can you become Lupin’s new apprentice?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Chimp!
boardgame.description:
CHIMP! is a game based on definitions of weird and wonderful words. Can you tell which are fakes and which are strange but true? Can you fool the others into making the wrong guesses? Can you make up some CHIMP! definitions of your own? Who will be first to score 25 points and win the game?

Take turns as a Reader, and whenever you are not the Reader, you are the Guesser. Up to 8 can join in and everyone is in play all the time. It’s great fun for those who love words and those who delight in telling lies with a straight face.

One each card there is one true definition and 2 fake definitions, but you also have the option of devising a 'CHIMP' which is a fake definition of your own, a tactic that offers more points.

CHIMP! is a pick-up-and-play-anywhere game that takes no setting up, is easy to learn and rewards mischief-makers from age 12 up.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Honor of Kings
Kings of Glory
boardgame.description: multiplayer online battle arena

boardgame.name: Hens
Курочки
boardgame.description:
A puzzly abstract card game of hens breeding.

In Hens you are a hens breeder! Each round you will play a hen card from your hand, trying to create a harmonious barnyard with different hen breeds. The rules to place cards are a few and simple, but the difficulty will be on making large groups of hens of the same breed.

At the end of the game you will gain points from your largest group of hens of the same breed in your barnyard, from your rooster token and from the goal card. Don’t forget some rare hens give you medals worth points at the end of the game.

The hens breeder with the best barnyard wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Choo-Choo Charles
Choo-Choo Charlie
boardgame.description: Navigate an island in an old train, upgrade it over time, and use it to fight an evil spider train named Charles, who terrorizes your home. These winding tracks are treacherous, so you'll need to plan each mission. Be careful when clearing your path on foot, or switching the tracks direction, because Charles might be waiting for you. Go looting or complete missions to find "Scraps", which can be used to turn your train, into a death machine on wheels. Prove yourself a worthy train killer, by gaining enough strength, firepower, and skill to take down the mechanical terror once and for all.

boardgame.name: Murder & Friends
boardgame.description:
Murder & Friends is a box with 2 scenario of murder party inside.
The particularity of this game is that there is no game master who organise the game. Everybody can play.

Each player receive a booklet at the beginning of the game with the description of his character. They will have to question each other to find the murderer.
A central board with different path with question cards can help solving the crime. But the murderer can influence the group to follow the path allowing him to escape and win the game.

boardgame.name: Lacrimosa
boardgame.description:
Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart is dead. His last conscious action on his deathbed was composing the Lacrimosa movement of his Opus Requiem. You, as one of his sponsors, will meet with the widow in order to participate one last time in the funding of the works of the Austrian genius. Also you will reminisce and retell all your memories alongside Mozart, in order to make sure that she portrays you under the best light when writing her memoirs, and enter history as Mozart’s most important patron.
In Lacrimosa players will take the roles of patrons of the late musician, contributing with their fundings to the composer's works one last time. During the game you will play in two different timelines: the present and the past. In the present you commission the missing parts of the Requiem from other composers in order to complete it. When developing past events, the game will play in five epochs in which you will contribute by buying new compositions from the composer to sell or exhibit, accompany him on the different journeys through the main courts and theatres in Europe, and gather the resources you need in order to support the musician during his career.

During the game you will be playing cards from a limited hand that you will improve as the game progresses. These cards can be played either as actions or as resource generators and players will need to optimise their resources and finances in order to support our best version of the story and our relationship with Mozart.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

boardgame.name: The Forest That Knows Your Name
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The sun is out. Smoke drifts from cookfires. Loggers nap in the shade, or dice beneath awnings on ramshackle yurts.

Nearby, raised voices. One petulant: “This path was to be cleared weeks ago!”
Another, defiant: “You ask the impossible. I need more soldiers!”

The Forest That Knows Your Name is a pointcrawl forest adventure for PINKHACK and other OSRs.

boardgame.name: Potbellied Kobold's Guide to Villains & Lairs: They of Many Colors
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

They of Many Colors is an ancient, feathered dragon; though it more resembles a serpent, lacking wings, legs, and claws. Often, in the taverns of larger cities, one might overhear a story about the giant-sized beast. These city-folk believe it to be a thing of myth and legend. It is not.

They of Many Colors considers itself a god, as do many of the people living amongst the forest where the beast lairs. Some pay tribute to They of Many Colors, leaving gifts of food, treasure, and drink on a stone pedestal in the forest near the dragon’s treetop lair. More malicious people lure adventurers to their god’s lair, as their own form of tribute.

boardgame.name: Goblingrief
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An original level 1-3 adventure made for D&D 5e.

The adventurers are hired by Lord Brendat Aradu to rescue his fiancé from a band of goblins who are holding him for ransom. What the goblins want is the enchanted sword Goblingrief so that they can destroy it. Lord Aradu claims the sword is in the catacombs, and if the party wants it, they’ll have to go get it.

boardgame.name: Double Clutch
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jump In

In the Sixth World, you can go from home to work to stores and back home again without touching a steering wheel or pushing a pedal, letting your vehicle and the networks it is hooked into do all your driving for you.

But why would you want to do that?

The accelerating jump of a vehicle when the clutch engages at just the right point, the smell of burning rubber, the sound of a thrumming engine that you can feel in the back of your sternum—those are the sort of things riggers live for—the sort of things they get when jump in to the right vehicle, tuned exactly the way they want it.

Double Clutch gives riggers a host of new options, including all sorts of vehicles and drones, as well as rules for customizing vehicles, making their own vehicles, and customizing their character to be the best rigger around. Everything they want is here.

boardgame.name: Eyno Bleside Docking Bay
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fast enough for you, old man...

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A pair of maps (60x60 and 50x50) depicting the surface and lower level of a landing pad/docking bay facility. Would work well for Mos Eisley cantina on Tatooine.
Joins with the rest of the Eyno Bleside range

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Baroncliffe Castle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Once the seat of the royal family, now the clifftop castle is a crumbling ruin, filled with secrets

A set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Castle Darkspire is huge, highly-detailed ruined castle. Overgrown walls, ancient chambers, extensive dungeons and crypts.

Contents: A multiple level map consisting of a multiple level storey castle, spread across 4 50x50 (one is 40x30) battlemaps, each depicting a different floor of the fortress.
Crypt - sea caverns and crypt tomb chambers
Dungeon - cellars and prison chambers
Ground Floor - ruined gatehouse, delapidated halls and rooms
First Floor - open to the elements, overgrown ruins.

Also includes night and winter versions.

boardgame.name: MountStop!
boardgame.description:
In MountStop!, each player is a seasoned climb leader and wants to prove to the world that they are the best; but so as a few others! For that, they need to win the biggest mountain climbing competition in the world by leading different teams to conquer the most famous mountains in the world.

In your turn, choose which mountain you want to climb and which of your teams you want to lead on this expedition. The higher the mountain the more points you’ll get if you reach the peak. You can also try to complete one or more of the random quests to gain more points. You’ll climb by rolling dice, one die for each climber on your team.

If all of your climbers are injured, your expedition was a failure and the next player starts his/her turn.

When any player successfully uses all her/his teams to conquer mountains, the game ends and the player with the most points is the winner.

boardgame.name: Boombeados
boardgame.description:
It is a dynamic and very explosive multiplayer card game. The participants will have to keep their 10 bombs intact as long as possible. Which will be very difficult, as the opponents will do their best to explode each other's bombs.

In the active turn, you will have to choose between playing a defensive card (equipment cards) or an attack card (boom cards to explode the other's bombs), and luck will also be present in with the dice.

In Boombeados everything changes very quickly.

boardgame.name: Noblecore
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Initiating emergency boot procedure. . .

Heroic destiny detected in proximity. . .

Activating NOBLECORE protocol. . .

Hello heroes. Welcome to the Halls of Destiny. If the NOBLECORE protocol has been activated, then Xarthanax has been successful. It appears that my memory banks have been corrupted. Give me a moment to do a quick galactic scan to get more information. Please wait. . .

NOBLECORE is a rules-light epic metal space-fantasy TTRPG where heroes become legends. It gets energy from bands like Gloryhammer, Dragon Force, Brothers of Metal, and others.

It has rules for easily assembling an exploding dice pool from the heroes' Titles, Prowess, Relics, and Torments, which makes rolls exciting and drives the story towards legendary moments that lead to Destiny or Doom!

It has simple mechanical progression that builds towards a hero's retirement or final defeat, followed by the retelling of their legend as they are written into the Halls of Destiny.

It has steps for communally creating Shards of the Shattered Galaxy and Points of Interest within them to give the heroes power to shape the story and give the GM ingredients to create a galaxy scourged by chaos and evil that must be stamped out.
boardgame.rpg: NOBLECORE: Fate of the Shattered Galaxy

boardgame.name: Castle Break
boardgame.description:
Castle Break is a Medieval adventure strategy board game with card drafting, trading, scenario/quest completion, and more.

Warriors (the players) have been chosen to represent their Kingdom in this year’s Castle Break Games. Players' task is to complete Quests by collecting Trade Goods, using Tools & Weapons, and harnessing their Magical Powers.

For each Quest completed, players are rewarded in coin. Earn 6 Coins, forge them into keys, and unlock the gates to DRAGON’S TOWER. There a player will free the dragon and achieve the title of this year’s CHAMPION.

Opponents can barter, steal, and outwit you using various powers and opportunities at every turn to achieve their aims.

boardgame.name: Observation
boardgame.description: Observation is a card game of speed and keen observation. Cats, dogs, wild animals, aliens, and robots have invaded the police station and are running amok. It will take a sharp-eyed detective to sort this mess out! Find four characters from the same collection faster than your friends or family and then ring the bell! You'll earn a detective badge and collect the cards. But be careful of those pesky penguins, you can count on them to mess up your collection! It's great family fun!!!

boardgame.name: ECO: Coral Reef
boardgame.description:
ECO: Coral Reef is an innovative and fast strategic game consisting of planning and placing variant tiles that create a colorful mosaic of marine life.

In this game, the participants will collect and place pictures tiles to create a shared image of a vibrant coral reef. Each player's personal and hidden interest, depending on their goals, reshapes and changes the map. What creates challenges and difficulties for the players also creates new opportunities for them.

While matching species and completing missions, each player advances his sea turtle towards the water line and to the victory.

The abstract gameplay feels like a combination of Dominoes & Chess.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tierra de Misión
boardgame.description:
Tierra de Misión is a game of cards and tokens with an educational and integrating purpose in the pastoral history issued by the missionaries of the Catholic faith in the mission of the Argentine Patagonia in a time of dispossession and persecution of the native peoples.

The objective of the game is to have accumulated the highest number of story points at the end of the game.

During three rounds, players select and play cards using a draft similar to 7 Wonders. Players start the rounds with 7-9 cards and 2-3 coins, depending on the player count. The cards have different colors and different scores, with some cards having an economic cost.

The cards stay in the table after each round, and the player with more points at the end is declared as the winner.

boardgame.name: Thunderstone Quest: Epic Thunderstone
boardgame.description:
Epic Thunderstone is a variation of Thunderstone that experienced players often enjoy playing.

Instead of a village with just four heroes and eight support cards, Epic uses all of the cards at your disposal, but only one copy of each.

In Epic your cards come randomly from select piles of cards in the village. Once you buy an available card you will be the only player in the game that has access to that card. It is quicker to set up and takedown, but a more challenging way to play the game for a less experienced player, as you have to adapt on the fly to what the village offers you.

Obviously some people like to play both ways. The difficulty has always been that taking one copy of each card out of your collection to play Epic - and then returning them when you want to play a more traditional set up is less than ideal. So, with this add-on we will provide you an additional copy of every card - each hero (and one for each level), each spell, item and weapon. There will also be one copy of each basic monster (there won’t be extra copies of cards that you do not need to be different for Epic, like treasures, basic cards, quests, Guardians and so on). You can store your Epic variant in your box and still enjoy playing traditional Thunderstone set-ups as well, without having to switch between the two.

With this add-on you’ll be able to play Thunderstone with different friends in different ways, depending on what each group prefers.

Full details on how to play Epic Thunderstone will be included in the rules.

listing.notes: Just in a plain white box, cards (still sealed) and dividers, nothing more. U

boardgame.name: Pentecostés
boardgame.description:
We cannot keep silent about what we have seen and heard.

Pentecostés is a game for both young people and adults where the book of the acts of the apostles covers by theme and narrative, in which each player must represent an apostle witness to the resurrection and assumption of Jesus Christ who will have to announce and testify to the message of the good news and to be forming their Christian communities encompassing the people of the different social classes of all the people of Israel in that historical period.

The player who has been the emissary with the highest score at the end of the game, adding the points of the cards of each community, plus the additional scores, will become the winner.

The objective of the game is to have accumulated the highest score at the end of the game. Where not only will win the one who accumulated the highest score in the community cards, but also the additional scores of the teaching of Jesus Christ and life goal that each of the players will have will be credited.

In each round, each player has their turn to perform two actions that allow him to:

Obtain Speech tokens: Do conversion actions with God to obtain tokens, to be used soon to obtain community cards.

Proclaim a card: Once you have the corresponding amount of tokens to exchange for one of the available cards, pay the corresponding cost for it to obtain the card you want.

Baptize a card: Once a community card is obtained, it goes on to add points. Now you can baptize it by paying the amount of corresponding baptismal tokens; and thus enhance your game for later.

The game ends once the community deck cards are used up, so there are no cards left to replace on the table. Each player starting with the starting player will have a last turn, where this time he will have the opportunity to do 3 actions to end his game and move on to the summation of points.

boardgame.name: Martian Expansion
boardgame.description:
An unofficial game set in the universe of The Expanse.

The players are Martians aiming to dominate the Outer Planets by controlling the most spacecraft destined for each planetary system. Each player has five agents who seek to gain control of spacecraft landing in the Docking Bay of Ceres Space Station before freedom fighters from the Outer Planet Alliance (OPA) capture the spacecraft, and before an OPA Uprising occurs which ends the game.

Quick to learn, set-up and play.

Push-your-luck against the other players, the game’s OPA, and the end of game Uprising which increases in likelihood throughout the game.

Solo mode: challenge yourself against the OPA.

boardgame.name: The Heroes of Thornwall (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Goblins are loose in the hills surrounding the town of Thornwall, and Mayor Hayward has learned that no reinforcements are coming from Dunbury Castle. You and your intrepid band of heroes are the only hope for this harried hamlet. If you cannot defeat the goblins and seal whatever Deepland hole they crawled from, Thornwall is doomed!

The Heroes of Thornwall campaign starter provides you with everything needed to launch your Fifth Edition campaign. Inside you’ll find:


An Introduction to Aetaltis: Discover Aetaltis, a fantastic new campaign setting where stalwart heroes fight to protect the people they care about from the rising forces of darkness.
The Town of Thornwall: A detailed town environment for your fantasy campaign. It includes a full map, detailed building descriptions, equipment lists, and a rich supply of exciting adventure hooks.
The Green Briar Tavern: A classic fantasy tavern where the party can relax after a long day at the dungeon! It features a color map of the tavern, an authentic medieval menu, recipes for making the cook’s specialties at home, and various tavern games.
The People of Thornwall: Stats for more than 20 non-player characters you can use to populate your town, including constables, farmers, merchants, priests, tavern staff, and woodwards.
The Temple of Modren: A heroic Fifth Edition adventure for 4-8 1st level characters. Delve into the Deeplands and face the dark power of the endrori as you begin your quest to save Thornwall!


It’s everything you need to start your campaign off right and support it for many adventures to come.

boardgame.name: La Carpinchada
boardgame.description:
La Carpinchada is a game for 2 to 4 players, where each person will have to lead a whole family of capybaras that will seek to dominate most of the entire Argentine wetland field. The first player who manages to dominate more territories than the rest, will become the winner. So the other groups of capybaras will have to look for a place in other territories, we recommend the south of Entre Ríos or north of Buenos Aires.

After setting up the play area, each player will have 4 cards of which they must play 1 on their turn, these will give them control of the number of capybaras to move and the directions or coordinates to move. Or those cards can also be actions of wildlife animals, which will give benefits that will be satisfactory in the game. Then the player will pick a new card from the deck to end their turn.

The game is over when a player wins by mastering his fourth game territory, and positions his domain token.

boardgame.name: Defenders of Dunbury Castle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dunbury Castle is threatened by a rising tide of darkness. Bandits stalk the roads, pirates raid boats along the riverways, and the power-hungry Warden Balewick seeks to seize control of the duchy in his mad lust for power. But an even greater threat looms: endrori and other dark creatures are creeping out of the Deeplands, and the sightings grow more frequent every day.

Defenders of Dunbury Castle is a complete adventure setting for your Fifth Edition game. It’s the perfect base of operations for the adventuring party as they make forays into the monster-infested wilderness that lies beyond the castle’s walls. It includes everything a gamemaster needs to support a multi-adventure World of Aetaltis campaign.

Inside the Defenders of Dunbury Castle you’ll find:


An Introduction to Region: Learn the rich history of Dunbury Castle and its environs, the many and varied threats that await characters, and the state of the region at the start of the adventure.
Military Life: Discover the secrets to running an exciting campaign where the characters become stalwart soldiers that guard the northern borders of Agthor.
Dunbury Castle: A detailed room-by-room description of the castle, from the highest tower to the lowest dungeon and everything in between.
Scir of Dunbury: Complete descriptions of the many key locations in the land around the castle, packed with adventure seeds and encounters for use in your campaign
People of Dunbury: Meet the many and myriad residents of the castle, from the castle’s leader, the courageous Captain Brazewhite, to the devious Warden Balewick—plus complete Fifth Edition stats for each entry.

boardgame.name: World of Aetaltis: Adventurer's Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Adventurer’s Guide is a book of wonders originally commissioned by none other than High Lord Drakewyn of Agthor himself and assembled by a dedicated team of veteran scholars from the Royal College of New Erinor. They created this landmark work to aid novice adventurers as they set out to fight the forces of darkness and build their legends.

In this reproduction of that invaluable text, you’ll discover:


A Complete History of the World: Discover the marvelous history of Aetaltis. From the creation of the enari, to Endroren’s tragic fall, to the momentous first arrival of the Atlan Alliance, you’ll unlock the myriad secrets of Aetaltis’s past.
Adventuring in Civilized Lands: Delve into detailed descriptions of the Amethyst Sea basin’s great powers and know you will not go unprepared when your quests take you to strange and distant countries.
Adventuring in the Wilds: Venture forewarned into the wild places of the world thanks to rich examinations of the best-known Aetaltan outlands, from the essence-soaked forests of the Elliyen Wilds to endrori-infested Deeplands.
Forces of Darkness: Cringe as you read frank descriptions of the horrors that await when you plunge into enemy territory to face the monsters, miscreants, and villains that threaten the good people of the world.
Metaphysical Wonders: Unlock the secrets of the cosmos as you learn the metaphysics behind the power of magic, the truth about death and the afterlife, and the secrets of the stars.
Expert Commentary: Find wisdom in sage advice from a bevy of expert commentators, whose insights, hints, and guidance appear throughout the book!

boardgame.name: World of Aetaltis: Gamemaster's Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The World of Aetaltis: Gamemaster’s Guide contains everything a gamemaster needs to turn their Fifth Edition World of Aetaltis games into legendary campaigns. It’s the third in the series of World of Aetaltis core books, along with the World of Aetaltis: Adventurer’s Guide and the World of Aetaltis: Player’s Guide.

Inside this book you’ll find:


Secret Gamemaster Info: An accurate timeline covering thousands of years of Aetaltis history, a geographically accurate version of the setting map, and a host of other secrets.
Minions and Monsters: Fifth Edition stats for more than 50 new Aetaltan monsters and NPCs.
Expanded Rules: Revised rules for diseases, poisons, NPC attitudes, and traps.
New Options: Brand new Fifth Edition rules for hauntings, magical corruption, goodwill, character resolve, skill specializations, investments, and more.
Forbidden Magic: A suite of new options for NPC spellcasters, including rules for dark magic, etiquette for entreating Endroren, and guidelines for the powers of evil clerics.
Divine Intervention: Complete rules for tracking characters’ favor and disfavor with the gods, plus an introduction to Divine Inspiration Cards, a system that lets players add to the story by roleplaying the gods.
A Toolbox of Wonders: Plus, information and rules concerning magical baubles, art objects, counterfeiting and coin clipping, building and room quality, the effects of aging, and much, much more!

boardgame.name: World of Aetaltis: Player's Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Discover the World of Aetaltis, an amazing new campaign setting designed for use with the Fifth Edition of the world’s best-known roleplaying game. In Aetaltis, you’ll unlock a setting that rekindles the fire of classic heroic fantasy game worlds. It’s everything that made fantasy RPGs such an incredible phenomenon, reimagined and refreshed for today’s gamers.

The World of Aetaltis: Player’s Guide includes everything you need to make a character for a World of Aetaltis game, as well as the Aetaltis rules you’ll need at the table over the course of your adventures! Inside, you’ll find:


Seven New Lineages (Plus All Your Old Favorites): Play one of the seven new Aetaltan lineages, including cheebats, drothmals, fairies, newardin, orogs, scythaa, and sprites. Or choose from your old favorites, such as humans, dwarves, elves, and halflings.
Cultures, Callings, and Finishing Touches: Add richness and depth to your adventurer with new character creation options. Choose from fifteen unique Aetaltan cultures, nine different callings, and a wealth of options for fleshing out your character’s history.
Heroic Character Classes: Everything you need to know to play your favorite classes in an Aetaltis adventure, plus the new Mountebank class.
New Point-Based Magic System: Discover the secrets of glyph magic, an exciting new system for point-based arcane spellcasting. Draw on the power of ley lines, charge your essence stones, and cast spells directly from newly recovered spellbooks. But beware! Roll a 1 and you face potential disaster with catastrophic spell failure!
And Much More: All of the great content described above, plus a dozen new divine domains, nine new backgrounds, new spells, and over twenty pages of equipment with a revised pricing system based on real 13th century European prices!


So grab your blade and spellbook, gather your most courageous companions, and get ready to start your adventure in the World of Aetaltis!

boardgame.name: Minsc and Boo's Journal of Villainy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the Journal of the Legendary Ranger and his Pet Hamster

A century has passed since the Bhaalspawn fought over the legacy of their father — Bhaal, the Lord of Murder. Two heroes witnessed the epic struggle firsthand — the ranger Minsc and his faithful companion, Boo.

Minsc and Boo were able to track down old friends and hated enemies and find out what they’ve been up to over the past century. They’ve compiled everything into this journal, edited by the traveler extraordinaire, Volo Geddarm.

Included in this journal are four cities, including Athkatla and Baldur’s Gate; ten group patrons led by some of Minsc and Boo’s old friends; a dozen new monsters; six arch villains and eleven dastardly henchmen.

boardgame.name: Drunken Adventures
boardgame.description:
Each player should have three 12oz beverages in front of them (alcoholic or nonalcoholic). The game involves rules that can either add sips or remove sips from a player's glass

Each turn players will roll the die and move their bottle cap piece to the corresponding square. There are 36 squares in the game. The squares may have you draw a card, play a mini-game, or require action. Each square will either decrease the number of drinks in your glass or increase your lifespan, so to speak. (I.e. giving drinks increases your glasses capacity while taking drinks lowers it)

Be among the first three players to make it to the finish line without finishing your three drinks. The game is a race to the finish with a gold medal (1st). silver (2nd), and bronze (3rd).

After a player gets sent back to the start or finishes their three drinks and is forced back to the start, they are not required to follow the “lifeline” rule but must follow the drinking rules.

The game ends when three players have reached the finish, achieving gold, silver, and bronze. Once a player has reached the finish, they are exempt from mini-games or drinking aspects of the game (unless they choose to join the fun).

boardgame.name: Calico: Eurohell Design Insert
boardgame.description:
You can prepare Calico in a flash with our insert!

As always, our organizer is language-neutral, can be stored vertically and is safe for transport, with lids that can be clamped under the trays at ease!

We offer two version for the bigger box with 26,5 x 26,5 x 8,2cm and the smaller one with 23,9 x 23,9 x 7,1cm.

boardgame.name: 3DMILL
Einsteinmill
三维谜
boardgame.description:
3DMILL is a three-dimensional strategy game for two players. Built on an ingenious board frame structure, 3DMILL breaks the limitation of two dimensions and integrates spatial concept into the game, thus stimulates spatial perception, cognitive skills and interactions between players.

Inspired by the classic game "Nine Men’s Morris", 3DMILL applies simple rules but has great strategic depth with more dimensions. Players need to achieve a plurality of forms in which three pieces are in one straight line in a three-dimensional space. It is fun to play for young and old!

Moreover, 3DMILL’s board construction is convenient to be dissembled and stored. Handy tweezers assist players in manual dexterity exercises when placing the game pieces. With a unique crystal-clear looking, the board is not only for playing games, but also an exquisite eye-catcher for distinctive art decoration.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Soldier Emperor: Byzantium Eternal
boardgame.description:
Our 40th issue tells an unusual tale of alternative history. The Byzantine Empire met its end in 1453, when the Ottoman Turks stormed its ancient capital, Constantinople, and the last emperor died fighting somewhere amidst the carnage. A few outposts would fall over the coming decades, and the Empire would never rise again.

In Byzantium Eternal, we add the Byzantines to our Soldier Emperor game, a Byzantine Empire that never fell. The Empire faced long odds in 1453, but it had miraculously survived even worse odds before. While it’s indeed improbably that the Empire could have survived another 350 years, it was just as improbable for it to have muddled through the previous 350.

boardgame.name: La Grande Guerre: Western European Field Battles, 1700-1763
boardgame.description:
La Grande Guerre is a miniatures wargame designed for entire large battles of the age of Continental linear warfare during the 18th Century.

The rules abstract details the brigade level into combat factors and modifiers. When brigade bases contact one another, the infantry/cavalry combat system combines all actions troops took within musket range of one another, including skirmishing, musketry, and charges, while artillery can also fight at a distance Simple but accurate mechanics allow players to concentrate on command decisions and the direction of troops, including grand tactical movement of reserves, rather than wade through the minutia of battle or numerous or complicated rules.

Players usually take the role of wing commanders, directing a few divisions, each of several brigades.
Many battles, such as Rossbach, can be played with one player per side.
The game rewards historical formations and tactics, while allowing more gifted commanders to innovate within the capabilities of forces during the wars of Spanish and Austrian Succession, and the Seven Years War (in Europe).
This game inflicts battlefield friction on the execution of command decisions. Each nation’s troop types have historical characteristics that place them in the proper balance with the other forces of their era.

These thoroughly playtested rules are written primarily for the Seven Years War, but have an intrinsic module for the War of Spanish Succession, with just enough adjustments to cover the differences in tactics and operation while keeping most of the same basic rules. Further expansions may cover the Great Northern War.

If players want to fight all of an 18th Century battle, rather than with some battalions or want to worry more about deployment, concentration of force, combined arms, and the commitment of reserves rather than where might skirmishers be, or when to change from column to line, La Grande Guerre is the game to play.

Sequence of Play:
1. Determine initiative.
2. The army with initiative moves each brigade or battery until all selected units have moved.
3. Resolve all active player combats. Conduct general risk tests.
4. The reacting side moves.
5. Resolve all combat for the reactive side. Conduct general risk tests.
6. Check for victory conditions. Proceed to next cycle.

–Description from the publisher
